alert.note: Alert for Lenawee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lenawee and southwestern Washtenaw Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 959 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Jonesville, or 8 miles north of Hillsdale, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. The strong thunderstorms will be near... Addison and Cement City around 1025 PM EDT. Onsted around 1040 PM EDT. Adrian around 1100 PM EDT. Tecumseh around 1105 PM EDT. Britton around 1115 PM EDT. Deerfield around 1125 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Seneca, Manitou Beach-Devils Lake, Macon, Lime Creek, Munson, Ogden Center, Canandaigua, Ridgeway, Palmyra and Tipton. People attending Michigan International Speedway should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
